text: Nathalie Saint-Criq (born in 1960) is a French journalist, working for France Télévisions. == Biography == === Training === Nathalie Saint-Cricq earned her degree from Sciences Po in 1983, and a "Diploma of Higher Specialised Studies" in marketing in 1985, before gaining a master's degree in literature. === Media career === Saint-Cricq produced reports for La Cinq and then France 2. From 2006 to 2009, she presented the programme Quand j'étais petit on Europe 1. She was then chief editor for the programmes Des paroles et des actes and À vous de juger on France 2. At the end of June 2012, she succeeded Fabian Namias as head of political affairs on France 2. On 3 May 2017, with co-hosted the televised debate of the second round of the French presidential election between Marine Le Pen and Emmanuel Macron. Since September 2017, she was a commentator on L'Émission politique on France 2, presented by Léa Salamé. In July 2019, she was promoted to become political editorialist of France Télévisions. === Personal life === She is the daughter of Jacques Saint-Cricq, president of the supervisory board of La Nouvelle République du Centre-Ouest, and the granddaughter of Jean Meunier, founder of the same newspaper, and French socialist politician, who took part in the French Resistance. The Saint-Cricq family is one of the two controlling shareholders of the Nouvelle République du Centre-Ouest press group, which edits the newspaper of the same name, several other titles in the written press, and owns a 40% share in the channel TV Tours Val de Loire. Saint-Cricq's brother, Olivier Saint-Cricq, is the head of the management board. Her partner is journalist . ==References== ==External links== * Category:Living people Category:1960 births Category:Sciences Po alumni Category:French political journalists
title: Nathalie Saint-Cricq
